Compatibility

Angular Base Apps is designed for and tested on numerous browsers and devices. It's built on some of the latest web technologies. Here's the rundown on what type of compatibility to expect.

Browser/OS Compatibility
Chrome ✓
Firefox ✓
Safari ✓
Opera 25+ (not Mini) ✓
IE10–11 ✓
IE6–9 ×
iOS 7–8 (iPhone) ✓
iOS 7–8 (iPad) ✓
Android 4.2+ (Tablet & Phone) ✓
Android 2 (Tablet & Phone) ×
Windows Phone 8+ ✓
Surface Tablet ✓


By and large, browser support for Angular Base Apps comes down to support for Flexbox.

No Support Detection

By using the ba-no-support attribute, you can easily display an overlay message to your users if they are using an unsupported browser. Place the following markup at the top of the HTML body:

For example, this app uses the following markup:

We're sorry, your browser does not support all required functionality needed to run our app. Please switch to a different device or browser and try again. You can update your browser here.

If you're using Internet Explorer, try turning off Compatibility View if it's enabled.

In order to use this feature, you must include Modernizr in your app with flexbox detection enabled. If you don't yet have Modernizr, you can download a minified build which only includes flexbox detection: https://modernizr.com/download?flexbox.
